hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification with ETF Flow Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: When a CPI surprise (actual vs. consensus > 0.2% absolute difference) occurs during NEUTRAL/BULL regimes, the initial 1-hour price move will be amplified by 1.5-2x over the next 4-6 hours if spot BTC ETF flows show divergence from the initial price reaction direction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: CPI surprises create strong directional bias, but ETF flow divergence indicates institutional positioning mismatch that amplifies moves as flows eventually align with price direction. Recent $600M liquidations show market sensitivity to macro catalysts.
entry_conditions: Initial 1-hour BTC price move > 1.5% in either direction
Hourly spot ETF flow data shows opposite sign to price move direction (e.g., price up but net outflows)
BTC 1-hour RSI(14) between 40-60 at release time

exit_conditions.take_profit: 6-hour cumulative move reaches 2.5x the initial 1-hour move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses beyond 0.5x the initial 1-hour move in opposite direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of qualifying events show amplification >1.3x over 6 hours, or ETF flows consistently follow initial price direction
